conclusion: Analyze forces on objects A and B using equilibrium principles to find rope tensions.
Objects A and B connected by ropes; A hangs vertically, B on horizontal surface; OP at 45° angle with vertical, OB horizontal.
Identify forces: Tension \( T_{OA} \) and weight \( m_Ag \) for object A; Tension \( T_{OB} \) and weight \( m_Bg \) for object B.
Equilibrium conditions: \( T_{OA} = m_Ag \) for object A; \( T_{OB} = m_Bg \) for object B.
Tension in rope OP: Vertical component \( T_{OP} \cos(45°) = m_Ag \); Horizontal component \( T_{OP} \sin(45°) = m_Bg \).
Solve for \( T_{OP} \): Equate vertical and horizontal components; \( \cos(45°) = \sin(45°) \); \( T_{OP} = \frac{m_Ag}{\cos(45°)} = \frac{m_Bg}{\sin(45°)} \).
Calculate \( T_{OP} \): Substitute values \( m_A = 5 \, \text{kg} \), \( m_B = 10 \, \text{kg} \), \( g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2 \); \( T_{OP} = \frac{50}{\sqrt{2}} = 35.355 \, \text{N} \).
